cnd21:0.3: 17. Extolling the Way to the Far Shore
cnd21:1.2: When he lived in the Pāsānạka Cetiya (Rock Temple) in Magadha.
cnd21:1.3: To the sixteen Brāhmaṇas who served Bāvari,
cnd21:1.4: He answered the questions of those who asked one by one.
cnd21:1.6: When he lived in the Pāsānạka Cetiya (Rock Temple) in Magadha.
cnd21:1.7: To the sixteen Brāhmaṇas who served Bāvari,
cnd21:1.8: He answered the questions of those who asked one by one.
cnd21:1.10: When he lived in the Pāsānạka Cetiya (Rock Temple) in Magadha.
cnd21:1.11: To the sixteen Brāhmaṇas who served Bāvari,
cnd21:1.12: He answered the questions of those who asked one by one.
cnd21:1.14: When he lived in the Pāsānạka Cetiya (Rock Temple) in Magadha.
cnd21:1.15: To the sixteen Brāhmaṇas who served Bāvari,
cnd21:1.16: He answered the questions of those who asked one by one.
cnd21:2.1: "The Blessed One said this": Speaking of the way to the far shore. "The Blessed
cnd21:2.2: One" is synonymous with respect. In addition, the "greed breaker" is the Blessed
cnd21:2.3: One; the "sickness destroyer" is the Blessed One; "the one who has destroyed
cnd21:2.4: conceit" is the Blessed One; "the one who has destroyed the thorns" is the
cnd21:2.5: Blessed One; "the one who has destroyed the pollutants" is Blessed One; "the one
cnd21:2.6: who has ended" is the Blessed One; "the one who has practiced the body, the
cnd21:2.7: precepts, the mind, and the wisdom" is the Blessed One; or "the Blessed One is
cnd21:2.8: close to the woods, wild forests, and border dwellings (sitting place), where
cnd21:2.9: speaking is lessened, it is quiet, away from the human atmosphere, alone, and
cnd21:2.10: suitable for sitting alone" is the Blessed One; or "the Blessed One is the one
cnd21:2.11: who divides clothes, food, shelter, the needs of patients, and medical
cnd21:2.12: necessities"; or "the Blessed One is the one who has the taste of righteousness,
cnd21:2.13: the taste of Dhamma, the taste of liberation, the increased precepts, the mind,
cnd21:2.14: and the wisdom"; or "the Blessed One is the four types of jhāna, the four
cnd21:2.15: immeasurables, the four formlessness, etc., the one who divides is the Blessed
cnd21:2.16: One"; or the Blessed One is the one who has the eighth liberation, the eight
cnd21:2.17: victories, the ninth dwelling place, etc.; or the Blessed One is the practice of
cnd21:2.18: ten thoughts, (ten) abidings, the one who (observes) the in and out of breath;
cnd21:2.19: the one who is purely divided is the Blessed One; or the Blessed One divides the
cnd21:2.20: four mindfulness, the four righteousness, the four divine bases (iddhipāda), the
cnd21:2.21: five faculties, the five powers, the seven enlightenment factors, and the eight
cnd21:2.22: branches of the holy path; or the Blessed One is ten Tathāgata, four
cnd21:2.23: fearlessness, four unobstructed solutions, six supernatural powers and the six
cnd21:2.24: enlightenment methods. "Blessed One," this name is not given by the mother; not
cnd21:2.25: given by the father; not given by brothers; not given by sisters; not given by
cnd21:2.26: friends; not given by relatives; not given by Samaṇas or Brāhmaṇas; not given by
cnd21:2.27: heaven; it is ultimate liberation; the establishment (of the pseudonym) for the
cnd21:2.28: acquisition and testimony of the Buddha, the Blessed One, under the Bodhi tree,
cnd21:2.29: and all knowledge and wisdom, that is, the Blessed One. The Blessed One said
cnd21:3.1: "Living in Magadha," when living in the kingdom of Magadha, acting, going on,
cnd21:3.2: guarding, and surviving. "When the Buddha lived at the Rock Temple," Buddha
cnd21:3.3: living at the Rock Temple is called the Buddha being seated there.
cnd21:4.1: "To the sixteen Brāhmaṇas who serve": Brāhmaṇas of Piṅgiya are the followers,
cnd21:4.2: attendants, servants, and disciples of Bāvari, and Piṅgiya and those are
cnd21:4.3: sixteen. Or, those sixteen Brāhmaṇas are followers, attendants, servants, and
cnd21:4.4: disciples of the Buddha, the Blessed One.
cnd21:5.1: "He answered the questions requested and questioned, one by one": "Requested,"
cnd21:5.2: sought, desired. "All asked," All questioned one by one; all asked one by one;
cnd21:5.3: all one by one begged; all requested; all asked to be made clear. "He answered
cnd21:5.4: the questions," he answered, explained, taught, informed, established,
cnd21:6.1: <em>94 : After one understands the answers to the questions one after another,
cnd21:6.2: Knowing the Dhamma, he can follow and practice it,
cnd21:6.3: He can go to the other side of old age and death;
cnd21:6.4: "These Dhammas lead to the other shore."
cnd21:6.5: Therefore, the name of the teachings of these Dhammas
cnd21:6.6: Is "the way to the far shore (Pārāyana)."
cnd21:6.7: <em>94 : After one understands the answers to the questions one after another,
cnd21:6.8: Knowing the Dhamma, he can follow and practice it,
cnd21:6.9: He can go to the other side of old age and death;
cnd21:6.10: "These Dhammas lead to the other shore."
cnd21:6.11: Therefore, the name of the teachings of these Dhammas
cnd21:6.12: Is "the way to the far shore (Pārāyana)."
cnd21:6.13: <em>94 : After one understands the answers to the questions one after another,
cnd21:6.14: Knowing the Dhamma, he can follow and practice it,
cnd21:6.15: He can go to the other side of old age and death;
cnd21:6.16: "These Dhammas lead to the other shore."
cnd21:6.17: Therefore, the name of the teachings of these Dhammas
cnd21:6.18: Is "the way to the far shore (Pārāyana)."
cnd21:6.19: <em>94 : After one understands the answers to the questions one after another,
cnd21:6.20: Knowing the Dhamma, he can follow and practice it,
cnd21:6.21: He can go to the other side of old age and death;
cnd21:6.22: "These Dhammas lead to the other shore."
cnd21:6.23: Therefore, the name of the teachings of these Dhammas
cnd21:6.24: Is "the way to the far shore (Pārāyana)."
cnd21:6.25: <em>94 : After one understands the answers to the questions one after another,
cnd21:6.26: Knowing the Dhamma, he can follow and practice it,
cnd21:6.27: He can go to the other side of old age and death;
cnd21:6.28: "These Dhammas lead to the other shore."
cnd21:6.29: Therefore, the name of the teachings of these Dhammas
cnd21:6.30: Is "the way to the far shore (Pārāyana)."
cnd21:6.31: <em>94 : After one understands the answers to the questions one after another,
cnd21:6.32: Knowing the Dhamma, he can follow and practice it,
cnd21:6.33: He can go to the other side of old age and death;
cnd21:6.34: "These Dhammas lead to the other shore."
cnd21:6.35: Therefore, the name of the teachings of these Dhammas
cnd21:6.36: Is "the way to the far shore (Pārāyana)."
cnd21:7.1: "As there is a question": As there are more questions from Ajita, as there are
cnd21:7.2: more questions from Tissa Metteya, one question from Punṇạka and Mettagū, as
cnd21:7.3: there are also questions from Dhotaka, I also deal with the problems of Upasīva,
cnd21:7.4: Nanda and Hemaka, as I also deal with the problems of Todeyya, and as I also
cnd21:7.5: deal with the two questions of Kappa, they are the same with the virtuous
cnd21:7.6: Jatukanṇị̄. As it is also a question from Bhadrāvudha, as it is also a question
cnd21:7.7: from Udaya, as it is also a question from Posāla, as it is also a question from
cnd21:7.8: Mogharāja, as it is also a question from Piṅgiya.
cnd21:8.1: "After knowing the reason, after knowing the Dhamma": The question is the of
cnd21:8.2: Dhamma, and the answer is the truth. After knowing the reason, after
cnd21:8.3: understanding, after weighing, after judging, after separating, after
cnd21:8.4: clarifying. "After knowing the Dhamma," after knowing the Dhamma, after
cnd21:8.5: understanding, .... In order to know the truth, after knowing the Dhamma. "Able
cnd21:8.6: to follow the Dhamma and practice": The correct way, following the way, the way
cnd21:8.7: that is not reversed, the way that has no contradiction, such as the meaning of
cnd21:8.8: the way, the way he can implement.
cnd21:9.1: "He can walk to the other shore of age and death": The other shore of age and
cnd21:9.2: death is called non-living, Nibbāna, that is the cessation of all actions, the
cnd21:9.3: cessation of all attachments, the extinction of craving, greed, annihilation,
cnd21:9.4: and Nibbāna. "He can walk to the other shore of age and death": He can walk to
cnd21:9.5: the other shore of age and death, can prove the other shore, can touch the other
cnd21:9.6: shore, and can testify to the other shore.
cnd21:10.1: "These Dhammas can go to the other shore": These Dhammas can go to the other
cnd21:10.2: shore, they make one to reach the other shore, reach the other shore completely,
cnd21:10.3: and they lead to the death of age and death.
cnd21:11.1: "Therefore the teachings of these Dhammas": "Therefore," the reason, the
cnd21:11.2: condition, the cause, when you see this fault in the attachment. "The teaching
cnd21:11.3: of these Dhammas is for this way to the far shore." For this reason these
cnd21:11.4: dhammas are taught. "Synonymously with 'the way to the far shore'": The far
cnd21:11.5: shore is called non-living, Nibbāna.... This is called the Path, that is: right
cnd21:11.6: view.... "Synonym": name, appellation, common name, naming, vocabulary, phrase.
cnd21:11.7: Synonymous with "the way to the far shore."
cnd21:12.1: <em>95 : Ajita, Tissa Metteya, Punṇạka and Mettagū,
cnd21:12.2: as well as Dhotaka, Upasīva, Nanda and Hemaka,
cnd21:12.3: <em>95 : Ajita, Tissa Metteya, Punṇạka and Mettagū,
cnd21:12.4: as well as Dhotaka, Upasīva, Nanda and Hemaka,
cnd21:13.1: <em>96 : Todeyya and Kappa, and the virtuous Jatukanṇị̄,
cnd21:13.2: As well as Bhadrāvudha, Udaya, and the Brāhmaṇa Posāla,
cnd21:13.3: The clever Mogharāja, with the great rishi Piṅgiya.
cnd21:13.4: <em>96 : Todeyya and Kappa, and the virtuous Jatukanṇị̄,
cnd21:13.5: As well as Bhadrāvudha, Udaya, and the Brāhmaṇa Posāla,
cnd21:13.6: The clever Mogharāja, with the great rishi Piṅgiya.
cnd21:13.7: <em>96 : Todeyya and Kappa, and the virtuous Jatukanṇị̄,
cnd21:13.8: As well as Bhadrāvudha, Udaya, and the Brāhmaṇa Posāla,
cnd21:13.9: The clever Mogharāja, with the great rishi Piṅgiya.
cnd21:14.2: The great rishi with excellent deeds,
cnd21:14.6: The great rishi with excellent deeds,
cnd21:14.10: The great rishi with excellent deeds,
cnd21:14.14: The great rishi with excellent deeds,
cnd21:15.1: "They approach to the enlightened one": "They," sixteen Brāhmaṇas, for the way
cnd21:15.2: to the far shore. "Enlightened One" that is the one who has enlightened the
cnd21:15.3: truth in the Dhamma that has not been heard before, and reaches the state of all
cnd21:15.4: knowing there, and the state of freedom in strength. What does "enlightened one"
cnd21:15.5: mean to be an enlightened one? "The one who feels the truth" is the enlightened
cnd21:15.6: one, the "makes the living being aware"..., the state of all knowing..., the
cnd21:15.7: state of all seeing, and the state that is not guided by others is the
cnd21:15.8: enlightened. Those who have flowed out are the enlightened ones, those who have
cnd21:15.9: exhausted their troubles are given names as enlightened ones, those who have no
cnd21:15.10: troubles..., those who have always been free from greed are enlightened, and
cnd21:15.11: those who have always been free from hatred. For the enlightened person, "the
cnd21:15.12: one who has always been away from ignorance" is the enlightened person, "the one
cnd21:15.13: who has always been free from pollution"..., the one who has crossed the road
cnd21:15.14: without crossroads..., and the one who has been alone is enlightened without
cnd21:15.15: (having been instructed). For the enlightened person, the state of not being
cnd21:15.16: killed is the enlightened person, and the state of being enlightened is the
cnd21:15.17: enlightened person. "Enlightened person," this name is not given (made) by the
cnd21:15.18: mother, not given by the father, not ...by the brothers, ...sisters, ...friends,
cnd21:15.19: relatives; Samaṇas or Brāhmaṇas; not given my heaven, this is ultimate
cnd21:15.20: liberation; the establishment (pseudonym) of the acquisition and testimony of
cnd21:15.21: the Buddha, the Blessed One, and the Bodhi tree, together with all knowledge and
cnd21:15.22: wisdom, is the enlightened one. "They approach the enlightened one": They
cnd21:15.23: approach, see, visit, ask, and question the enlightened one.
cnd21:16.1: "The rishi with sufficient action": The action is called the arising of the vow,
cnd21:16.2: and the self-control of the vow is action; the self-control of the root is also
cnd21:16.3: action; it is also action to know the right amount of diet; it is also action to
cnd21:16.4: specialize in sobriety; the seven principles [MN.53] are also action; the four
cnd21:16.5: meditations are also actions. "Those with sufficient actions," those with
cnd21:16.6: sufficient actions, the best actions, the highest actions, the first actions,
cnd21:16.7: the winning actions, and the top actions. "The rishi," why is the Blessed One
cnd21:16.8: the Great rishi? The "seekers, and pursuers of the great precepts" are the great
cnd21:16.9: rishis. ...of the great concentration..., ...of the great liberation
cnd21:16.10: aggregate..., "the seeker and pursuer of the great liberation of wisdom and
cnd21:16.11: insight" is the great rishi; the fragments gathered by the dark..., the
cnd21:16.12: destruction of the great upside down..., the pulling out of the big arrow of
cnd21:16.13: thirst..., the unraveling of the accumulation of sight..., the lifting of the
cnd21:16.14: big conceit flag, ...the calming of the great work..., the calming of the big
cnd21:16.15: torrent..., the laying down of the heavy burden..., the severance of the cycle
cnd21:16.16: of the great reincarnation..., the disappearance of the great heat..., the
cnd21:16.17: cessation of the great heat..., "the seeker and the pursuer who lifts the flag
cnd21:16.18: of Dhamma in his heart" is the great rishi; the great minds..., the great
cnd21:16.19: exertion..., the great divine bases..., the great roots..., the power..., the
cnd21:16.20: great enlightenment branches..., the big eight branches of the holy path...,
cnd21:16.21: "the immortality of the great supreme benefit, the seeker of Nibbāna, the
cnd21:16.22: pursuer" is great rishi; "sought, pursued, and searched for by powerful beings:
cnd21:16.23: Where is the Buddha? Where is the Blessed One? Where is the god among the gods?
cnd21:16.24: Where is the bull king among people?" Such is the great rishi.
cnd21:17.1: "Asking subtle questions": "Asking," inquiring, begging, asking; making it
cnd21:17.2: clear. "Subtle questions," deep, hard to see, hard to follow, and silent,
cnd21:17.3: triumphant, non-theoretical, delicate, and experienced by the wise.
cnd21:18.1: "Close to the most victorious Enlightened One": "Enlightened One," That is the
cnd21:18.2: Blessed One.... "The most victorious," the first, the most victorious, the
cnd21:18.3: great, the superior, the highest, the most winning, the top enlightened one,
cnd21:18.4: they approach, come close to, meet, visit, inquire, and ask.
cnd21:19.1: <em>98 : The enlightened person thoroughly answered for them,
cnd21:19.5: <em>98 : The enlightened person thoroughly answered for them,
cnd21:19.9: <em>98 : The enlightened person thoroughly answered for them,
cnd21:19.13: <em>98 : The enlightened person thoroughly answered for them,
cnd21:20.1: "The Enlightened One provides a thorough answer for them": "For them," for the
cnd21:20.2: sixteen Brāhmaṇas, of the way to the far shore. "The Enlightened One," ....
cnd21:20.3: "Thorough answers," the enlightened one thoroughly answers, explains, teaches,
cnd21:20.4: informs, establishes, uncovers, analyzes, and clarifies for them.
cnd21:21.1: "Questions asked, truthfully": "Questions asked," questions asked, questioned,
cnd21:21.2: begged, requested, and made clear. "As they are," explain like that as it should
cnd21:21.3: be explained; teach like that as it should be taught; tell like that as it
cnd21:21.4: should be told; build like that as it should be built; uncover like that as it
cnd21:21.5: should be uncovered; unfold like that as it should be unfolded; parse like that
cnd21:21.6: as it should be parsed; clarify like that as it should be clarified; what should
cnd21:21.7: be stated is stated like that.
cnd21:22.1: "To answer questions": To answer questions, explain, teach, inform, establish,
cnd21:23.1: 'Muni satisfied the Brāhmaṇas": "Satisfy," make satisfaction, expand
cnd21:23.2: satisfaction, make clear, make joy, and produce pleasure. "Brāhmaṇas," ....
cnd21:23.3: "Muni" is called wisdom, that is wisdom, understanding, simple selection,
cnd21:23.4: investigation, discernment, recognition, discrimination, close observation,
cnd21:23.5: inspection, learned virtuous wisdom, proficiency, cleverness, study, reflection,
cnd21:23.6: review, contemplation, examination, general comprehensive wisdom, vipassanā,
cnd21:23.7: right knowledge, stabbing rod, wisdom root, wisdom sword, wisdom palace, wisdom
cnd21:23.8: brightness, wisdom light, no delusion, choice of dhamma, right view. The Blessed
cnd21:23.9: One has the wisdom of Muni, reaching Muni. There are three Muni (perfect
cnd21:23.10: virtues): body Muni, language Muni, intention Muni.
cnd21:24.1: What is the body of Muni? The three types of body and evil deeds are cut off as
cnd21:24.2: the Muni position; the three types of good behaviors are the Muni position; the
cnd21:24.3: wisdom in the body is the Muni position; the knowledge of the body is the Muni
cnd21:24.4: position; walking the Path with (higher) knowledge is the body of Muni; the
cnd21:24.5: abandonment of desire and greed, cut off, as the Muni; the fourth jhāna
cnd21:24.6: extinction of the body is the position of Muni.
cnd21:25.1: What is the language of Muni? The abandonment of the four types of evil deeds of
cnd21:25.2: language is the position of Muni; the four types of good acts of language are
cnd21:25.3: the position of Muni; the wisdom of linguistic objects is the position of Muni;
cnd21:25.4: the knowledge of language is the position of Muni; and knowing the path of all
cnd21:25.5: acts is the position of Muni; the abandonment of desire and greed of language is
cnd21:25.6: the position of Muni; the second jhāna cessation of language is the position of
cnd21:26.1: What is intention Muni? The three types of deeds of intention and evil deeds are
cnd21:26.2: the Muni position; the three types of good deeds are the Muni position; the
cnd21:26.3: wisdom in the mind-object is the Muni position; the knowledge of the heart is
cnd21:26.4: the Muni position; the one that walks the Path with knowledge is the position of
cnd21:26.5: Muni; the desire and greed of the heart being judged is the position of Muni;
cnd21:26.6: the desire to perish the mind is the position of Muni.
cnd21:27.1: "Body Muni, Language Muni, and Intention Muni are no troubles,
cnd21:27.2: Muni has the status of Muni, and they say he is the one who cuts everything.
cnd21:27.3: Body Muni, Language Muni, and Intention Muni are no troubles,
cnd21:27.4: Muni has the status of Muni, and they say that they are those who have been cleansed of evil."
cnd21:28.1: The six types of Muni have these three modes of Muni: Muni at home, Muni without
cnd21:28.2: a home, Muni with learning, Muni without learning, Bhikkhu Muni, Muni (of the)
cnd21:28.3: Muni. Which is at home? Those laymen who have seen the footsteps and have
cnd21:28.4: learned the precepts, these are at home. Which are homeless Muni? Those bhikkhus
cnd21:28.5: who have seen the footsteps and who have learned the precepts are homeless Muni.
cnd21:28.6: There are seven types of learning for learning Muni, Arahant for non-learning
cnd21:28.7: Muni, and Bhikkhu Buddha as Bhikkhu Muni. Muni (of) Muni is called Tathāgata,
cnd21:29.1: "Non-wise is Muni, a foolish and ignorant man,
cnd21:29.2: After raising the scale, take the top one and become a wise man.
cnd21:29.3: Avoid all evils, that Muni became Muni because of that,
cnd21:29.4: Everyone who understands the (inner and outer sum) in the world,
cnd21:29.5: Because that is said to be Muni.
cnd21:29.6: Who knows all the inside and outside of the world,
cnd21:29.7: The unwholesome and the good behind the Dhamma,
cnd21:29.8: Everyone who is supported (respected) by heaven and man,
cnd21:29.9: Beyond staining and the net, he is Muni."
cnd21:30.1: <em>99 : They, satisfied by the all-seeing one,
cnd21:30.2: The enlightened, he of the sun tribe,
cnd21:30.3: Lived a spiritual life in front of the noble and wise.
cnd21:30.4: <em>99 : They, satisfied by the all-seeing one,
cnd21:30.5: The enlightened, he of the sun tribe,
cnd21:30.6: Lived a spiritual life in front of the noble and wise.
cnd21:30.7: <em>99 : They, satisfied by the all-seeing one,
cnd21:30.8: The enlightened, he of the sun tribe,
cnd21:30.9: Lived a spiritual life in front of the noble and wise.
cnd21:31.1: "They are satisfied by the all-seeing one": "They," ... "Satisfied," ....
cnd21:31.2: "All-seeing," all-eyes are called the state of all knowing wisdom. The Blessed
cnd21:31.3: One has the state of intelligence, of fully having, entering, fully entering,
cnd21:31.4: sufficiently having, having all the knowledge.
cnd21:32.1: "For him, there is nothing unseen here (in this world),
cnd21:32.2: There is no knowledge that cannot be known,
cnd21:32.3: He proves that everything that exists should be guided by inference,
cnd21:32.4: Because the Tathāgata, like that, is all-eyes."
cnd21:33.1: "The enlightened person, the person of the sun tribe": "The enlightened person,"
cnd21:33.2: .... "Sun tribe": Sun (ādicco) is called the sun (sūriyo), his surname is
cnd21:33.3: Gotama, the Blessed One is also a surnamed Gotama, the Blessed One is a relative
cnd21:33.4: of the sun surname, so the enlightened person is a member of the sun tribe.
cnd21:34.1: "Live a spiritual life (doing Brahma)": Brahma is called separation, abstinence,
cnd21:34.2: withdrawal, renunciation, detachment, no action, no misdeed, no offense, no
cnd21:34.3: transgression, no destruction of the bridge Or, because there is no difference,
cnd21:34.4: the Brahma is called the eight noble paths, namely: right view, right will,
cnd21:34.5: right speech, right kamma, right life, right effort, right thought, right
cnd21:34.6: concentration. "They do Brahma": They do, practice, and turn to Brahma after
cnd21:35.1: "In front of the noble and wise": The noble and the first, the most wise, the
cnd21:35.2: supremely wise, the uppermost wise, the highest wise, the top wise. "In front,"
cnd21:36.2: As taught by the enlightened person,
cnd21:36.3: Anyone who can practice like that
cnd21:36.4: Can walk from this shore to the other shore.
cnd21:36.6: As taught by the enlightened person,
cnd21:36.7: Anyone who can practice like that
cnd21:36.8: Can walk from this shore to the other shore.
cnd21:36.10: As taught by the enlightened person,
cnd21:36.11: Anyone who can practice like that
cnd21:36.12: Can walk from this shore to the other shore.
cnd21:36.14: As taught by the enlightened person,
cnd21:36.15: Anyone who can practice like that
cnd21:36.16: Can walk from this shore to the other shore.
cnd21:37.1: "One by one questions": One by one questions by Ajita, ...(omitted), ...by
cnd21:38.1: "As taught by the enlightened person": "Enlightened one," .... As explained,
cnd21:39.1: "Anyone who can practice like that": He can practice the right way, follow the
cnd21:39.2: way, the way that is not opposite, the way of righteousness, and the way of the
cnd21:40.1: "Able to walk from this shore to the other shore": The other shore is called
cnd21:40.2: non-living, Nibbāna...; this shore is called pollution, aggregates, and
cnd21:40.3: creations. "Can walk from this shore to the other shore": He can walk from this
cnd21:40.4: shore to the other shore, can prove to the other shore, touch the other shore,
cnd21:40.5: and testify to the other shore.
